Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, old, but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Peterc2020
Reviews.Content: No great views from this hotel, but convenient to shopping. It has a great lobby with a bar that terrace steps down to their restaurant underneath a huge atrium. The rooms are old, but are very clean and have been well maintained. Like most Doubletrees, the staff is very friendly and helpful. I have stayed here for several small conferences and meetings, and it has been very well laid out and accommodating for small meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: nvtravel31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night while on business in the area. It is an older hotel but well maintained. In my opinion the biggest plus for this hotel is its friendly staff who wanted to make sure your needs were met. At breakfast, my server checked several locations to see if they had the kind of bagel I wanted - they didn't but I appreciated the effort and stuck with my original choice! I went to arrange a cab for a short ride and the transportation captain said they would be happy to take me in their van when I was ready and followed through with someone ready to go when I came back - great service! One complaint is the air conditioner took a few hours to really cool down the room - it was hot and steamy in Dallas so maybe that couldn't be helped. The price for my stay was reasonable compared to other hotels and the location convenient if you have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Monte B
Reviews.Content: This place is a very well run Doubletree. The staff is great and the rooms are clean and well equipped for the business traveler. It is in a convenient location for both airports and for doing business in the north Dallas/Ft. Worth area. The fitness rooms is excellent. The breakfast buffet is incredible if you like all of the usuals and a good variety of fresh fruit. The bar is a very good hotel bar with some great bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value!”
Reviews.Author: PeekytoeLouisiana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near the Galleria, with a shuttle to and from for convenience. It's very reasonably priced, has a wonderful breakfast buffet, great rooms and best of all, incredible guest service. My husband and I stay there every time we are in Dallas and Julie and all the associates are unfailingly pleasant and welcoming. No charge for parking, right off I-635, comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinghappy6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in Feb 2012. It was my first trip to Dallas, and the price was $99 a night and the king bed was very comfortable. They greet you with a hot cookie when you check in, and upon request they gave me another cookie later in my 4 day stay. They run a shuttle van at no extra charge at set times back and forth to the Galleria, a large shopping mall nearby. I had a wonderful vegetarian grilled sandwich twice for lunch while there because it was good. Across the street, walking distance, is a restaurant called Saltgrass. I had shrimp stuffed with cream cheese, wrapped in bacon, and coated with barbaque sauce. I would recommend it. For the cost in a large city, this place is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: homingpenguin
Reviews.Content: The location is great; it has good interstate access and is nearby plenty of shopping and restaurants. The hotel is an older facility that has received a lobby makeover in relatively recent days, and even though the air conditioner and the toilet were surprisingly loud, the room was definitely adequate. Free Wifi and free parking are also big pluses.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED; better than 99.9% of all hotels I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Afe1984
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here! We booked 3 nights and EVERYTHING was perfect. From the bed to the food to the staff, every little and big thing was just great. I've stayed at the cheapest hotels and I've stayed at some really nice ones too: everything from Motel 6 and La Quinta to the Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons. This hotel has the quality of service and staff that the Ritz and Four Seasons had...helpful, polite, happy. The beds are super comfy, the rooms have plenty of space and are very clean. You can tell the hotel is VERY well maintained. I can't say enough how happy I am to have found this spot, we'll definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “why would someone have a conference here?”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChiro
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this Doubletree Hotel "near the Galleria " and and asked myself why would someone have a conference here. Upon walking into the lobby, I asked the front desk person where a certain room was that the conference was being held. Not only did the front desk person not know,they asked two other people and no one had any idea where the meeting room was. I ran into another member attending the conference and they told me it was down the hall. I walked into the room, which apparently used to be a restaurant/bar and was surprised that the overall setup and sound quality of this room. I was pleased that the bathrooms were near, but upon visiting those bathrooms wondered how long it'd been since they had been cleaned. Needless to say, the odor made quite a bad first impression. From there it was all downhill. As I struggled to focus on the conference content due to the sounds of the heater kicking in , because it sounded like an 18 wheeler was driving through the room. The speaker did his best to overcome the negativity of the hotel accommodations, but one can only imagine what the rooms look like if the meeting rooms for this poor. Fortunately it was in my hometown and I did not have to stay at this hotel. One last comment how they claim this is near the Galleria is beyond me. Near would indicate within walking distance and this is definitely not within walking distance. To summarize, I put in my comment card to the conference that I hope they change locations to better reflect the nature, content, and class of their organization as this hotel did not reflect that. Sorry. Better luck next time

Reviews.Title: “Underrated”
Reviews.Author: Craigsworld
Reviews.Content: Makes me a bit sad sometimes when I see a well run hotel, with quality common areas, a good restaurant especially for breakfast, and well appointed rooms rated average by reviewers. I read the reviews and stayed here anyways, given the great room rate and proximity to my meeting location. I could not be happier with my choice - stayed three nights and could not have been more pleased. The staff, from front desk to wait staff to shuttle drivers were all first class. The hotel is not really well located, sort of behind a Walmart, near the LBJ Parkway and a mile away from the Galleria. But that is my only complaint. My room was comfortable with a flat screen TV, quality shower, well functioning air system, and comfortable bed. I would recommend this hotel for anyone requiring a stay north of downtown Dallas. It's also within 20 minutes of DFW airport. Go to this Doubletree and you'll get more than just a good chocolate chip cookie.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel that's In good shape”
Reviews.Author: SbciochDenver
Reviews.Content: Our hockey recently stayed at the hotel for a Dallas tournament. The hotel is older, but clean. It appears that it was recently remodeled. Their continental breakfast was very good and well serviced. The staff was great, though the hotel was hosting several events and they did not have enough wait staff to accommodate the needs of everyone. There were more than two hockey teams on the premises, plus a Nerium convention. The hotel could have made a lot of money in food and beverage if they had staffed accordingly. The maid service was excellent and the beds were clean and comfortable. The wood blocks used to prop up the bed frames weren't appealing. The TV's in the room are large but do not come with HD. The channel selection is also limited. The room was overpriced. They charge our team $99 each, when you could go on to any travel site and get the same room (with breakfast) for less. It would seem you would get a discount for buying more rooms. But that wasn't the case. Overall, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: Dorrie9
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this Doubletree. Pros: *Staff gave me a 2 p.m. check-out, which was very kind since I had an afternoon appointment. *The front desk clerk was friendly and quick. I appreciated the warm cookie. *Room was quiet, and I slept very well. *Wolfgang Puck coffee was good. *Room was clean. Cons: *Both queen beds in my room sagged and were not firm. *Hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. Popcorn ceilings, worn carpet, and peeling paint in the shower in my room. I can't believe this is a 3 1/2 star hotel! *Parking spaces are very narrow in parking lot. Many cars are straddling the lines. *Worst of all, I took a bath the night I arrived and a shower the next day, and the water was NEVER HOT. It was only lukewarm. The swivel knob on the shower would not turn past the middle of the temperature gauge--it seemed to be bolted that way. I don't know if this was a problem with just my room or not, but no hot water is unforgivable in a hotel! I was going to report the problem at check out, but the line was too long.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction guaranteed !”
Reviews.Author: Lacp
Reviews.Content: We have held our corporate gatherings/seminars at this hotel 2 sometimes 3 times per year, for the last 5 years, and have never been let down! If we have ever had an issue with a guest room, or our conference room, it was dealt with very quickly and efficiently, by a great staff. The lobby area is open and inviting; my employees tend to spend a lot of time socializing in the bar area, lol ! We request food/beverage service during our seminars, and everything is fresh and plentiful. Also, the room rates are great - great service, great accommodations, great value - the reason why we keep going back !

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kellynicole85
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself isn't the most amazing thing I've ever seen but the beds are to die for!!! They call it sweet dreams package and it is!!! Crisp sheets nice pillows and I mattress I wanted to take home. The food is good but pricey. Room service is fast. No balconies on rooms or on any floor - if you smoke you have to go all the way outside the front door. Bathroom is odd - sink and vanity look new/updated while the tub/shower looks dated. Overall - the room was very clean and nice for the price

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: BSLGY
Reviews.Content: Stay was for a conference. Facilities were fine. Conference food was ok. Ate dinner at "Chefs Table". Steak was over done. Ordered rare and came medium to medium well. Never saw waiter until he brought me the bill and asked why I didn't eat the steak. Vegetables and potato were GOOD but not the entree!

Reviews.Title: “Misled by Website”
Reviews.Author: MDCarolina
Reviews.Content: The website leads you to believe that you're surrounded by shops and restaurants, but you cannot walk to them (looking out my window I wonder where they are; all I see is highway), or to the Galleria (advertised as "steps away"). They offer a shuttle to the Galleria, but only every three hours. The hotel is definitely tired; my shower needs retiling and the room adjoins another, something I try to avoid at all costs. I selected this hotel because MicroTek recommends it and you get a better rate; note that the MicroTek website says internet is free here and it is not. $10 a day is ridiculous, especially for such a slow connection at a hotel that calls itself business friendly. This is not an "elegant" hotel, but it is comfortable enough. People are very friendly, room service was quick and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: marcshiman
Reviews.Content: I'm tough on hotels, particularly large chains that fail to live up to their advertisements, but this Doubletree was an excellent value. From the moment I checked in, everything went as well as could be expected. The desk clerk was friendly and helpful (actually, everyone working for the hotel I encountered was), the room although a little old was clean, big, comfortable. The meals were good. There was plenty of parking, even with two large events going on at the same time. The room wasn't very modern, and the TV was dated - but there were electrical outlets where you needed them. I didn't think the room lights provided enough working light, and I thought the mattress was getting tired, but these are minor complaints. I really like this hotel, and a lack of a 5th star for me isn't a put-down.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Smell in our room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica N
Reviews.Content: Our room had a horrible smell. It was so bad that we left at 6:30am this morning. We were supposed to stay another night but there was no way!! The hotel was not clean at all. We stepped off the elevator on the 2nd floor yesterday and saw dirty towels lining the hallway and trays of food and pizza boxes on the table. The trays and boxes were still there this morning!! The pool was filthy. There were rocks on the bottom and again, dirty towels everywhere! We were very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff...great cookies!”
Reviews.Author: sharynjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a mini-vacation to take our daughters to Hurricane Harbor (which is on the opposite side of the metroplex). Parking was so simple--we realized too late that it's much better to park in the back. Oh well, live and learn. The room was nice--typical hotel room. Nice soaps and hair care available in the room. My girls loved the pillows, so much so that one said "Look, you can tell I stayed in the same position all night!". We did not eat in the restaurant, but we did enjoy Luby's which was close. There are several eating options if you don't want to eat there--Saltgrass, Taco Bell, Luby's, etc. Overall, our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad rude check in staff, but a nice hotel. Same treatment last 2x's.”
Reviews.Author: LAV79
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel over the years several times, however the last 2 times the front desk personnel was very rude. You have to ask for a bell hop and hope they can find one before you actually get all of your own luggage into the room. The hotel is nice, however judging by the people staying there and the lack of tactfulness with the staff, I will pay much more to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wish I could live there”
Reviews.Author: LongTimeRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: not enough can be said about this hotel, from checkin to the pool, the concierge lounge, the parking - the fact that as an elite member they give you access to the sports club across the street. It is easy to get anywhere you need to be - located on the corner of two major roads.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinJB
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Doubletree while in Dallas visiting friends. We checked in and dropped our stuff into the room and turned the AC down because it was SO hot in there. We came back about 6 hours later and it was still very hot. We thought we could manage it, but 11:00 came around and we could not go to sleep. I called the front desk and she said she would have someone up to take a look at the AC. The guy came and just opened the vents more. It did not help at all. About an hour later I called back down to the desk and she just said she would move us into another room. She didnt even apologize for the inconvinience of having to move rooms in our pajamas with all of our things at midnight. We were so mad. We got our bill under the door when we woke up and we were still being charged full price for the stay. I expressed our aggravations to the girl at the front desk and she was nice enough to comp our stay. She wasnt the rude one that was on duty during the night. I am disappointed in the staff at this hotel and we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jackal106
Reviews.Content: +++ Nice staff Clean rooms Close to a good steakhouse Next to a 24-hour walmart Next to a jogging trail --- Small food selection at the bar No flat screen TV !! No indoor pool Far from downtown No pedestrian access to Lincoln center Small gym and not so many equipment

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: PeekytoeLouisiana
Reviews.Content: We stay often at this hotel, and are always greeted warmly when we arrive. (Warm chocolate chip cookies are offered on arrival, and always available later on request as well.) Rooms are very nice, the rate is terrific (we pair it with our AAA card for a significant discount), and a full breakfast is included with our stay. (The breakfast may be because we are Hilton Honors members.) Free parking in their lot, all spaces close to the hotel. We have stayed here 7 or 8 times, and have never had a problem. Close to the Galleria, right off I-635, we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Drujon
Reviews.Content: I actually have stayed here a few times over teh past year and was very pleased each time. I obvioulsy made my visits after the renovation was done because each of the rooms that I stayed in were 'brand new' and very nicely decorated and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have experienced. The rooms were a very nice size and hed nice ammenities. This hotel is a tad off the beaten path but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice hotel. Great Cookies!”
Reviews.Author: drdon366
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip for 2 nights. Great location, close to major highways and the galleria.

Reviews.Title: “LiL bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: normzilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a pretty lobby, great looking restaurant and friendly staff. However, the shared internet PC are in a not-so-private area. The rooms are not impressive with their 22 channel 25 inch tv. No spa or working swimming pool. Gym is small. I prefer some of the other 3 star hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We love this property”
Reviews.Author: sunnyg08
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth event at this property in the last 18 months. We just love coming back. The staff always goes above and beyond. Our events are always very succesful and I know I couldn't do my job as a planner without Donna who is available 24/7 during the retreats. Great F & B staff that makes you feel special. Superb front desk staff that remembers your name when you return. If you have a late night craving, make sure to order something from room service and if this is a "special" stay (wink, wink) call ahead of time and talk to Chef to make sure your perfect night with the perfect person is complete..... Like someone else said before, this is one of the few properties that I have stayed at where you can actually meet the GM by the front desk and he will wish you a pleasant stay. THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH.

Reviews.Title: “FOr the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: biffbulkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. Rooms and overall facilities well kept and clean. Staff was wonderful. Not much entertainment in walking distance but hotel shuttle can get you where you need to go. 24 hour WalMart next door comes in handy for when the airline loses your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times for work. They are making updates. The first one is the workout room. It is really above par for a hotel. The rooms are still a bit worn. However, I am a Hilton Honors Gold member so I get the best rooms. Before I was Gold the rooms were hit or miss. The front desk staff is really nice. They try. The buffet in the morning is also above par for a hotel buffet. There too the staff tries to make it good. My only big complaint in the wireless network. If you are in a room at the end of the halls it can be slower than if you are in a room by the elevator. The beds are clean and of high quality. It can be difficult to get to if you don't know exactly where to go. The road in front of the hotel is one way. If you can get a good rate and need to do business in the area this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dirtnap101
Reviews.Content: There was some contruction going on, but it never bothered me. The first room I was given had a non-smoking badge on it, but it reeked of cigarette smoke, so I went back to the front desk and asked for another. The second room was fine, a normal room but next to the Presidential Suite on the 4th floor. Service was fine, location was decent, and the Saltgrass steakhouse across the street was convenient. This is just a decent business hotel with some renovation going on.

Reviews.Title: “"Pardon our dust"? "Don't bother until it's finished"”
Reviews.Author: Five-Oh-States
Reviews.Content: We paid $189 plus taxes for a room that looked like it hadn't been decorated in fifteen years on a corridor in the process of being refurbished although nobody appeared to be working on the refurbishment during our stay. The ice and vending facilities were out of use while the floors were being re-tiled. The signs said, very helpfully, "Pardon our dust". I'm sure it'll be nice when the refurbishment is finished and the staff were up to usual Doubletree standards. To be honest, though, I'd steer clear unless the hotel can guarantee you a room in a part of the building where the work has already been completed. The parking spaces are TINY, by the way, so be prepared to breathe in if you're getting in or out of a normal or larger sized car!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel - nothing more”
Reviews.Author: DavidDC
Reviews.Content: This is a typical corporate hotel. Nothing more, nothing less. Its hard by the freeway, so if you're looking for something bucolic, this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Dallas Hotel - No major issues”
Reviews.Author: Superbuyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed once at this DoubleTree but I am a Hilton HHonors Diamond member & have stayed at many DoubleTree/Hilton properties. This would be average property & I will stay again on a future trip to Dallas. The Executive floor room was nice, clean & what you would expect (free up-grade due to my Diamond status). The room faced the freeway but I heard nothing (good sound proofing). The rate included full American breakfast but next time I will pass on this. The food was cold & not very good. I never tried the restaurant at night or for lunch (too many good restaurants locally). The hotel staff at check-in was excellent & no problems in my long weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rporta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree based on the reviews on this site and were very disappointed. We've stayed at other Doubletree Hotels but this was by far the worst one. In general, the rooms could have used an update, the bathroom had hair on the floor, the bed was not very comfortable and almost flipped over when I sat at the edge of it, and the hotel staff was not very friendly. We went for a conference and was surprised at how empty the hotel was and found out later that most people ended up staying at the Wyndham which we noticed was a lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Standards of Everything”
Reviews.Author: Englishlaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to rank as one of the BEST in Dallas, Texas or the World for Service, Standards and Accomodation. They cannot do enough for you - just ask. We were just overwhelmed. We have stayed in Westins, Sheratons and Hyatt Regency all over the USA and the world and would have difficulty remembering somewhere better than this. We stayed in October 2005 for eight nights from Britain and just loved everything. GIVE IT A TRY.

Reviews.Title: “Texas State Conference of NAACP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Texas State Conference of NAACP Branches would like to commend the staff of the Doubletree Hotel on their professionalism and proficiency during our recent 69th Annual Convention on October 6th-8th. Without a doubt, all our requests and last minute needs were carried out timely and flawlessly. Our attendees were complimentary of the friendliness of employees, from the cleaning staff to the GM, who actually stood in the lobby on several days and greeted and shepherded our members. I did not receive one complaint about individual sleeping rooms or meeting space or food from any attendee, which is a true measure of the tremendous efforts of the Doubletree staff. The food, oh yeah, the food was a big hit. The two chefs were known to many of the conventioneers and everyone commented on how delicious the food was for all the events. Chef Morris and Chef James will forever be considered the State NAACP favorite chefs. Meal service was timely and done not to disrupt or disturb our presenters. I was always asked when the main entree should be served....this was incredible. The Banquet Manager Clem is the master of getting rooms set-up, banners hung, and food served without a hitch. Let's talk about the facility....I can not say how many times, at the last minute, I called for AV needs and again we received flawless execution. He was always sensitive to the time and followed through on my every request. The Catering Manager, Fran who came in a few weeks before our convention deserves a medal. She made a fan out of my husband and insured on every level the success of our convention. Kudos and many thanks to the staff at the Doubletree, and we hope to visit again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: mamaspearl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 2-6 and had a wonderful time. The room was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I do wish that the rooms had more lighting. My room had two lamps and they must have had 30 watt bulbs because the lighting was so dim. When you leave the room after dark, make sure to leave a lamp on because there is no ceiling light near the entryway. Hence, you will have to stumble half-way across a very dark room to turn on one of the lamps if you don't. The concierge service was excellent and so was the food in the restaurant. The restaurant, bar, and lounge area are gorgeous and conducive for relaxation. There's a waterfall, lots of plants, and plenty of private, comfortable seating in the lounge. The equipment in the excercise room is in good shape. However, the room is located in a corner on the lowest level of the building. As a single woman, I didn't always feel safe in there alone. The hotel is also within walking distance of a Walmart, a Wendy's, a steakhouse, and a family restaurant. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Westin a run for its money”
Reviews.Author: Patiod
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Westins, and am spoiled by the Heavenly Bed (although I've noted many of their pillow-top mattresses are getting deflated and hard). This Doubletree (formerly the Renaissance) at 635 & Midway was clean, the service was friendly, and the bed was better than most of the Westins I've visited lately - comfy mattress, comforter, and lots of fluffy pillows. Decent bathroom, and everything spotlessly clean. Concierge level features a nice free breakfast (with some hot items), and the hotel buffet is good as well (with the now-mandatory omelet chef). Had dinner one night in the empty restaurant, and it was excellent (if a little pricey). Free parking, which you can't take for granted anymore. The exercise room has 1 Precor, 3 treadmills 2-3 bikes, freeweights, and some universal equipment -- I prefer a well-furnished little weight room to paying $10-$20 to schlep over to some "nearby" mega-fitness center, but that's just me. There's an outdoor pool for warm-weather vistors.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Dallas Near the Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 4099 Valley View Lane, Dallas, TX 75244
